definition: to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手畫腳|比手画脚
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: They played charades with the participants on stage.
sentences.chinese: 他们在台上与观众玩比手划脚。

definition: to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
(onom.) to jabber/to rumble
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
see 嘰哩咕嚕|叽哩咕噜[ji1 li5 gu1 lu1]
to make eyes/to wink
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
strange accent/odd manner of speaking or singing
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
confused/disorderly/incoherent
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
variant of 比劃|比划[bi3 hua5]
to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
